{"step_by_step_thinking": "Warfarin is a known teratogen and can cause warfarin embryopathy, especially when used in the first trimester of pregnancy. Acenocoumarin is also a vitamin K antagonist like warfarin and can have similar teratogenic effects, so it is not a good option either. Heparin, on the other hand, does not cross the placenta and is safe to use in pregnancy.
